data.title: Graphical glitch, garbled interface

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:18:03.540Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 3.16.0-4-amd64 Debian 3.16.43-2
  - Gnome Version : 3.14.1
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.9.1|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.5|
|gitlens|eamodio|4.2.0|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0|
|search-node-modules|jasonnutter|1.1.1|
|java|redhat|0.6.0|
|vim|vscodevim|0.9.0|
|nodejs-extension-pack|waderyan|0.1.9|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch VSCode
2. Switch to full-screen
3. Launch Node.js debugger

---


![screenshot from 2017-06-27 14-40-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21345269/27597872-f95b8730-5b63-11e7-80c3-eecdb46acacf.png)

Screenshot is unaltered except for the terminal area which has been blurred for privacy.
The garbled areas vanished one by one, when I hovered the cursor above them.

This happened randomly and I was unable to reproduce.

I am not familiar with VSCode's code, but I think it might be caused by Electron itself.

data.title: Yeoman "generator-code" generates old-style tasks.json with warning
Allow users to choose the character to display invisibles

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Personally, I don't really like the → rendered as tabs in the editor. Adding the ability to let the user choose what is displayed for each of the invisibles would be a great addition, imo.

data.title: Settings: folderValue versus workspaceValue
data.body:
Tests https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29466

- write extension that reads configuration with the getConfiguration2 API.
- have the setting be overridden on the workspace level

Observe: when using inspect the folderValue is not set. For the new API I would have expected that workspaceValue is undefined and folderValue is set.

data.title: Do not trimForExclusions
Updating a sym-link file outside is not getting updated in Multi-root workspace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #29478

- Set up multi workspace with two Folders A and B. Assume that B has `.vscode/settings.json` file.
- Create a sym link in `B/.vscode` folder named `symlink-settings.json` pointing to `settings.json`
- Open `Folder B` in VS Code separately, from now I call single root workspace.
- Open `symlink-settings.json` in both workspaces
- Update the file in single root workspace

Expected that sym link file is also updated in multi root workspace. But not.

data.title: files.exclude and files.watcherExclude have different behaviour for same globs
data.body:
Testing #29478

In a multi root workspace, for a second folder you have following folder settings

```
	"files.exclude": {
		"**/.git": true,
		"**/.svn": true,
		"**/.hg": true,
		"**/CVS": true,
		"**/.DS_Store": true,
		"**/samples": true
	}
```

Folder samples and its files are excluded, which is good. 
Now have following folder settings for it

```
	"files.watcherExclude": {
		"**/.git/objects/**": true,
		"**/.git/subtree-cache/**": true,
		"**/node_modules/**": true,
		"**/samples": true
	},
	"files.exclude": {
		"**/.git": true,
		"**/.svn": true,
		"**/.hg": true,
		"**/CVS": true,
		"**/.DS_Store": true,
		"**/samples": false
	}
```

Folder samples and its files are shown. But watcher is not excluding files under samples folder.

data.title: Too many exclude settings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #29478

Currently I feel like we have too many exclude settings in the settings.json, what is worse I am not sure what is their relation and which one applies where.

Do we really have user sceanrios that people want to fine grain this and that one exclude is not enough to bind them all?

files.exclude
files.watcherExclude
search.exclude

data.title: Show Task Log opens Output pane instead of Integrated Terminal
data.body:
Testing #29618.

1. Clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node and do npm install's
2. Run any task without configuring.
3. Go to Task -> Show Task Log
It opens Task output in the 'Output' pane, rather then terminal, where task was run by default.

We should refer to integrated terminal instead, if we moved tasks execution there. Or open UI element where last task was executed.

data.title: Allow binding 'open' gestures in contributable views
data.body: Selecting changes can already be bound, but that triggers to easily, e.g., for opening external editors.

data.title: multi root: cannot paste across root folders
data.body:
testing #29466:

- select file or folder in one root
- context menu "copy"
- try to paste into other root

Observe: "Paste" is always disabled

data.title: Workspace searching with a negative lookahead fails
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click on search icon on the left for whole workspace searching
2. Try searching with `:(?! )` and it will complain that the `!` was unexpected:

![screen shot 2017-06-27 at 10 46 03 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/325473/27593777-0de27256-5b26-11e7-8d9b-dfdd60c6eed7.png)

I can use that same regexp when searching in a file just fine, just the workspace level searching:

![screen shot 2017-06-27 at 10 47 22 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/325473/27593792-13de6246-5b26-11e7-8c25-8bc3671c5bb1.png)

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Restart task is not triggered from command and top level menu
data.body:
Testing #29618.

1. Clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node and do npm install's
2. Run the following task `task tsc: build client\src\tsconfig.json` through Task menu
3. Once terminated, do 'Task -> Restart Task...' from menu.
Observe that nothing happens.

Same happens if restart task is triggered from command palette. I assume this is because we moved tasks to a terminal by default.

data.title: (discussion) Tasks: Configure Tasks vs. Customize Tasks

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
There are currently two ways to customize/configure tasks when the user has no tasks.json:
- select a detected task and select the Customize action for this tasks. This creates a customized entry for the selected task in the task.json and the tasks.json file is opened.
- select Task>Configure Tasks. This presents the user with a pick list for templates and a task.json is generated from a template. If there is already a tasks.json then it is opened directly.

We should try to unify the Customize and Configure flow. For example:
- always use the term "customize"
- Task>Configure/Customize Tasks shows a quick pick with two sections: 'templates' and 'detected tasks'. If there already is a task.json then the 'templates' section is not shown.
- Run Task: when there is no tasks.json then it also offers the use to create a tasks.json from a template. Prompt the user with a prompt "create a task.json from a template/customize a detected tasks"  [not happy with this one yet]

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Testing #29618

I have a setup which persists terminal sessions across Code executions, described here: https://medium.com/@joaomoreno/persistent-terminal-sessions-in-vs-code-8fc469ed6b41

With this setup, I can't run any tasks. When running a task, the Terminal pops up and nothing happens.

data.title: Contribute problem matcher for the webpack ts-loader
Test: task discovery
data.body:
Tests: #28235 

- [x] macOS - @joaomoreno 
- [x] any os - @michelkaporin 

Clone some GitHub repositories that use typescript, npm or gulp and test how tasks are discovered. Examples to clone are:

- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node: if you use that open he jsonrpc sub folder 
delete the tasks.json file and test task discovery
- https://github.com/AngularClass/angular-starter.git

While testing it trigger all actions from the menu instead of the Command Palette

data.title: Same, same but different Task-ctors
(Discussion) Tasks: Reduce the Task related quick open handlers
data.body:
Tasks currently contributes different quick open handlers for:
- build task
- test task
- task
- terminate task
- restart task

Now that we have a Task menu do we still need all the quick open handlers? 

In particular it confused me when I ran "Task>Run Build Task" and I got presented with the 'build task' quick open handler:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27591780-1079872a-5b53-11e7-808a-8a1b64f77b18.png)

It appears that I'm presented with all detected tasks and not only the build tasks.
For the first time user it would be more intuitive to now show Quick Open but to show a Quick Pick with an explaining message as is done when the user picks a problem matcher.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27591907-6dea28ec-5b53-11e7-995d-1af5d7fac810.png)

data.title: useRipgrep enabled/disabled by folder
data.body:
Refs: #29510

Windows, insiders

1. Have multi root open, in a root have a gitignore file (example use vscode repo as a slave folder and have it in gitignore ignore `src`). 
2. Check off the ignore checkbox in search
3. Search for `debugservice` and notice that you get results though search should pick up the gitignore and not look inside the src folder

data.title: Smoke Test: commiting changes fails with 'Failed to execute git'
data.body:
Build ID: 30080
Test name: _Smoke Test Suite Git stages, commits change to 'app.js' locally and verifies outgoing change_

Same behaviour as in #28721, but git is in place this time, and I was able to commit myself through the shell.

data.title: Polish: Adapt task is already running message to refer to the Task menu
data.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27590744-e836b286-5b4f-11e7-8bc8-f546fb272e2b.png)

Now that we have a menu we can guide the user to the menu, e.g.,

"The task 'npm' is already running, To terminate it use 'Terminate Task' from the Task menu"

Check the code whether there are other opportunities to leverage the Task menu

data.title: Improve presentation of problem matcher picker
data.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27590144-fde1343c-5b4d-11e7-9d62-16ec3b1b1472.png)

Suggest to show the variable as the description of the quick pick item as shown below and to not use `[]`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27590438-062f451a-5b4f-11e7-9ad0-6ab5defacfd3.png)

You can also turn it around and show the variable name as the item and the description afterwards.

data.title: QuickOpen looks misaligned in monokai theme
data.body: Due to how colors are blending together. Notice the color of the input and the selection of quick open and how the black background blends into the viewlet, so the input looks misaligned.
